title: Question:
author: buwaytress
created_time: June 21, 2022, 02:01:20 PMLast edit: April 10, 2025, 01:57:10 PM by buwaytress
content: This is the discussion thread for the Europa League, the second-tier UEFA club competition held annually.Champions League thread is here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5403488Europa Conference League thread is here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5403490Hi guys! New thread now self-moderated. Appreciate also if you use the report function for spam. Kindly keep the discussions to the correct thread!The 2023/24 season starts on 10 August with the qualifying rounds. Official schedule is here: https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/027a-1641dbb4e215-91bce93221b1-1000--2023-24-europa-league/++++++++++++++++Reference and Past Season threads:Previous season thread from 2019-22 here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=51615512022/23 Winner: Sevilla (Penalties 4:1, AET Sevilla 1:1 Roma)2023/24 Winner: Atalanta (3:0 FT)

comments.author: snipie
comments.body: I will add these information here to simplify things QuoteEuropa League qualifiers : 4, 11, 18, 25 August 2022Group stage : 8, 15 September 2022 + 6, 13, 27 October 2022 + 3 November 2022Knockout stage : 16, 23 FebruaryRound of 16 : 9, 16 March 2023Quarter-finals: 13, 20 April 2023Semi-finals: 11, 18 May 2023Final: 31 May 2023QuoteEuropa League draws :ï»¿Third qualifying round: 18 July 2022ï»¿Play-off round: 2 August 2022Group stage: 26 August 2022Knockout round play-off: 7 November 2022Round of 16: 24 February 2023Quarter-finals & Semi-finals: 17 March 2023As I suggested in CL thread, It would be nice to implement a poll where we can suggest a winner from which league then in mid season or round of 16 we modify the poll to include clubs.Here it is more complicated to vote directly in clubs since teams from CL will join EL once they lose there.

comments.author: Ramiza
comments.body: Manchester United have reached full agreement with Barcelona for Frenkie de Jong, after further talks. Package worth â‚¬85m. Fee guaranteed around â‚¬75m plus add-ons. ðŸš¨ðŸ‡³ðŸ‡± MUFCPersonal terms, still the issue to be resolved - as Frenkieâ€™s priority is to stay at Barcelona.

comments.author: 3meek
comments.body: I think this Europa League season will be won by an English or Spanish club, as has usually been the case for the last 10 years... To be honest last season I was very surprised to see teams from Germany and even Scotland playing in the finals... Although lately some Italian clubs have been playing very well too... Roma or Lazio also deserve to play in the finals...

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: 3meek on July 14, 2022, 07:50:53 PMI think this Europa League season will be won by an English or Spanish club, An English club most likely, and if I am to be more specific, I would say either Arsenal or Manchester united. Arsenal first because we played well last season but Tottenham stole our spot to the champions league because of the better quality their squad had. Arteta has really made some useful additions to the team in the likes of Jesus and co, With a complete squad, if not plagued by injuries, we can go really far. Manchester United will also want to prove a point, their new coach is building a new team, one that doesn't revolve around Ronaldo, and that is good. In their pre season game against Liverpool, we saw an improved performance, next season is going to be better most certainly.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: Quote from: Ramiza on July 14, 2022, 04:09:19 PMManchester United have reached full agreement with Barcelona for Frenkie de Jong, after further talks. Package worth â‚¬85m. Fee guaranteed around â‚¬75m plus add-ons. ðŸš¨ðŸ‡³ðŸ‡± MUFCPersonal terms, still the issue to be resolved - as Frenkieâ€™s priority is to stay at Barcelona. I think this comment is better suited for the âš½ Football Transfers Speculation, Odds and Predictions as this is where the talks about most of the deals go down. Here is a new thread for the Europa League competition although, Manchester United is a team in the Europa League, what your talking about at the moment is transfers!Quote from: Rruchi man on July 14, 2022, 08:46:50 PMQuote from: 3meek on July 14, 2022, 07:50:53 PMI think this Europa League season will be won by an English or Spanish club, An English club most likely, and if I am to be more specific, I would say either Arsenal or Manchester united. Arsenal first because we played well last season but Tottenham stole our spot to the champions league because of the better quality their squad had. Arteta has really made some useful additions to the team in the likes of Jesus and co, With a complete squad, if not plagued by injuries, we can go really far. Manchester United will also want to prove a point, their new coach is building a new team, one that doesn't revolve around Ronaldo, and that is good. In their pre season game against Liverpool, we saw an improved performance, next season is going to be better most certainly.I think it's mostly going to be an English team like you've suggested. They came quite close last season and we've often seen them to form most of the dominant side in the competition and this season, we've seen teams like Manchester United and Arsenal to be working deals out to improve there squad. They are sure to do well.

comments.author: Oluwa-btc
comments.body: Quote from: Rruchi man on July 14, 2022, 08:46:50 PMQuote from: 3meek on July 14, 2022, 07:50:53 PMI think this Europa League season will be won by an English or Spanish club, An English club most likely, and if I am to be more specific, I would say either Arsenal or Manchester united. Arsenal first because we played well last season but Tottenham stole our spot to the champions league because of the better quality their squad had. Arteta has really made some useful additions to the team in the likes of Jesus and co, With a complete squad, if not plagued by injuries, we can go really far. Manchester United will also want to prove a point, their new coach is building a new team, one that doesn't revolve around Ronaldo, and that is good. In their pre season game against Liverpool, we saw an improved performance, next season is going to be better most certainly.Laughable to say Tottenham Hotspur stole Arsenal's spot on the league table. And for the winners it's totally Unpredictable I can't make a final conclusion on who wins. Premier League Club's ?Â  Too many strenuous game's in the premier league you need depths and the Europa league is played on Thursday nights.Don't take the tour games so serious, Manchester United has enough shitty hell stuff's to handle out even the coach knows that very well.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: these europe league games are giving me headaches, i tried to place bets on some of them but the result is a big disaster, predicting the result of a game between strange teams is the hardest thing that is being for me, it seems that these teams are matching each other to get these results. It's not possible that I can't make a profit in these games. I'm giving up betting on these games Quote from: Oluwa-btc on July 14, 2022, 11:11:23 PMDon't take the tour games so serious, Manchester United has enough shitty hell stuff's to handle out even the coach knows that very well.it reminded me that cristiano ronando seems to devalue this europe league a lot, he is trying hard to leave manchester united because he doesn't want to play in the europe league. I wonder what's so humiliating to play in the europa league? although I particularly hardly watch these europa league games, I only bet on the games

comments.author: snipie
comments.body: Didn't pay attention to the poll but to answer the question I selected Arsenal.Well it is very early to pick a team right now but until now I find that Arteta is making a lot of effort to build a strong squad without forgetting that Arsenal was doing good in the previous season.If I could select another team it would be Roma, mainly due to presence of Mourinho.For ManU, I am not very confident about them yet. It appears that they are getting better, they won with 4 goals to 0 vs Liverpool but it is a friendly game after all.

comments.author: Zackgeno96
comments.body: It seems that Man United have built a nice team and the necessary other reinforcements are also on the way. With the new coach, United is certainly one of the contenders to win the title at the EL. However, there are many other teams that are equal or close, so it is certainly not a foregone conclusion. It would be nice if we get a final again just like last year with two teams that are lesser on paper. I'm not sure what to expect from Arsenal. They can play beautiful football, but too often changeable, resulting in certain failures.

comments.author: Joca97
comments.body: Quote from: Zackgeno96 on July 15, 2022, 08:44:27 PMIt seems that Man United have built a nice team and the necessary other reinforcements are also on the way. With the new coach, United is certainly one of the contenders to win the title at the EL. However, there are many other teams that are equal or close, so it is certainly not a foregone conclusion. It would be nice if we get a final again just like last year with two teams that are lesser on paper. I'm not sure what to expect from Arsenal. They can play beautiful football, but too often changeable, resulting in certain failures.I think its still really early for us to guess who will be the winner of EL. Last year everyone was thinking Barcelona was gonna take it and they got knocked out early in the playoffs. So even with Man Utd being one of the best teams it will be hard to win it because its a lot harder now

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: Well, would you know it, we get our round of games today and some familiar faces already starting out. My picks of what I'd say are favourites are Maribor, Fenerbahce, Olympiacos and even Shamrock Rovers -- but if you're like me and you love upsets, I'd bet against all of these guys tonight!Any special insights from anyone?

comments.author: Alisha-k
comments.body: Quote from: Zackgeno96 on July 15, 2022, 08:44:27 PMIt seems that Man United have built a nice team and the necessary other reinforcements are also on the way. With the new coach, United is certainly one of the contenders to win the title at the EL. However, there are many other teams that are equal or close, so it is certainly not a foregone conclusion. It would be nice if we get a final again just like last year with two teams that are lesser on paper. I'm not sure what to expect from Arsenal. They can play beautiful football, but too often changeable, resulting in certain failures.. Â With their performance as of late, I think the the Gunners are capable of carrying the EL and even tho they can be unpresentable sometimes, I'm certain Arteta will be correcting that anomaly.Â  With their pattern of play, they can upset Chelsea and even Liverpool in the Premier league standings.

comments.author: 3meek
comments.body: I wonder how Fenerbahce will play today against Slovacko... The Turkish club successfully dropped out of the Champions League due to poor results, but now they have a good opportunity to prove themselves in the Europa League... The bookmakers of course made Fenerbahce the clear favourite, but recently Slovacko played Trabzonspor 2-2... I would wonder...

comments.author: morvillz7z
comments.created_time: August 04, 2022, 02:22:59 PMLast edit: May 13, 2023, 11:36:47 PM by morvillz7z
comments.body: I've locked Fenerbahce -1AH...i think they are the favorites to advance, and they should consider themselves unlucky not to be playing in the Champions League right now. I watched the reverse fixture with Dynamo Kyiv, they dominated despite playing the second half with a man down, missed quite a lot of chances, including a penalty. I'm not sure why they went back into their own half in extra time, played a lot more defensively in an attempt to force penalty shootouts i guess...and eventually, they got punished.According to my scouting report on Slovacko, the team is mostly made up of local players, with only one or two international guys. They finished fourth last season, about 20 points behind Plzen, nothing really that impressive in their preseason matches, with the exception of the aforementioned tie with Trabzonspor. Btw, Fenerbahce's team market value is more than 20x that of Slovacko...

comments.author: CLS63
comments.body: In only less than two hours, Fenerbahce which are my team are going to host Slovacko in the first leg match. After having an unfortunate short run in the Champions League they are continuing in the Europa League now. Slovacko aren't a very serious opponent for Fenerbahce at all. They just need to concentrate on the match completely to prevent any surprises. By the way, the odd given to Fenerbahce can be taken into account seriously too. They can even win the match by at least a two-goal difference so I think you @morvillz7z have made a really nice choice.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: Personally, I would avoid betting on Olympiacos today. They looked so bad against Maccabi Haifa and in general, start of season isn't going well for them. Malmo just changed coach and Dudelange isn't most difficult opponent. But I doubt that they will win big, ubder 3.5 @1.75 is my pick. I also made parlay of Fenerbahche and Zurich ML @1.89. And maybe I will go Partizan win @2.30.

comments.author: Joca97
comments.body: Quote from: LTU_btc on August 04, 2022, 03:16:02 PMPersonally, I would avoid betting on Olympiacos today. They looked so bad against Maccabi Haifa and in general, start of season isn't going well for them. Malmo just changed coach and Dudelange isn't most difficult opponent. But I doubt that they will win big, ubder 3.5 @1.75 is my pick. I also made parlay of Fenerbahche and Zurich ML @1.89. And maybe I will go Partizan win @2.30.You were right. Olymipakos barely saved themselfs against Slovan Bratislava in todays match. They were attacking the entire match but werent able to win it. Fenerbahce was an easy win today. Partizan leaded 0-1 but ended up losing 2-1 and thats was a pretty big shock today.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: So, probably Fenerbahche and Malmo is in next round already, it's difficult to expect that their opponents will make an comeback from 0:3. HJK made big statement by beating Maribor 0:2 away, before game it was very difficult to predict something there. AEK win is probably biggest surprise today, but despite their minimal win, Partizan is still favorite before 2nd leg in Belgrade.
